description: From nefās. Compare with nefārius, nefandus, infandus.

adjectives.description: nefāstus (feminine nefāsta, neuter nefāstum); first/second-declension adjective

entries.meaning: (of a day) on which judgment could not be pronounced or assemblies of the people be held
(figuratively) contrary to the sacred rites or to religion; irreligious, impious; wicked, profane, abandoned; unlucky, inauspicious; hurtful
